sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
An act concerning the new invention of melting down iron and other mettals with stone-coal and other coals, without charking thereof. England and Wales. Parliament.
p. 1335-1337.
Printed by John Field, Printer to the Parliament of England, [London : 1651]
Caption title. Imprint from colophon. With an order to print dated 2 April 1651. Giving inventor Jeremy Buck a 14-year privilege. Signatures: 10M-10M2. Also issued as part of a through-paged set with a table for the entire set added. Last word of first line of text: "of"; first word of line below initial: "without"; last word of last full line on page: "the". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
